properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 17 at 8:11PM CST by NWS Paducah KY
properties.description:
...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in
Illinois...

Big Muddy River near Plumfield affecting Franklin and Williamson
Counties

...The flood warning continues for the following rivers in
Illinois...
Big Muddy River near Murphysboro affecting Jackson County

.The Big Muddy River at Plumfield is forecast to briefly fall below flood
stage Saturday, but will climb back above flood stage Sunday, reaching a
crest of 20.4 feet Monday. It will then fall back below flood stage Tuesday
afternoon. Murphysboro has crested, but will remain above flood stage at
least through the end of next week.

The Flood Warning continues for
the Big Muddy River near Murphysboro
* until further notice.
* At  7:30 PM Friday the stage was 28.4 feet.
* Flood Stage is 22.0 feet.
* Moderate flooding is occurring and Moderate flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The River will continue to fall to a stage of 26.8 feet
by Sunday morning.
properties.instruction:
SAFETY MESSAGE...

Never drive cars...trucks or sport utility vehicles through flooded
areas. The water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow
children to play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to NOAA Weather
Radio or your local media for further statements and possible updated
forecasts.

Additional information is available at
http://www.crh.noaa.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=pah /lower case/
